author: Mick Gadd
title: Bastian Schweinsteiger puts Man United behind him as he jets to Chicago Fire with wife Ana Ivanovic and a grin
text:
Sport Bastian Schweinsteiger puts Man United behind him as he jets to Chicago Fire with wife Ana Ivanovic and a grin The Germany legend ends 18 months to forget at Old Trafford as he begins a new life in the MLS Share Bastian Schweinsteiger and Ana Ivanovic jet off for a new life in Chicago (Photo: anaivanovic/Instagram) Share Get football   Thank you for subscribing!   
Bastian Schweinsteiger has jetted off to the US with a smile on his face and wife Ana Ivanovic by his side to begin his life with the Chicago Fire. 
The German World Cup winner showed class throughout his time as an outcast at Manchester United and handled his departure with the same quality. 
And now he appears to be beaming to be off to Major League Soccer for the next chapter of his illustrious career. 
Schweinsteiger and now-retired former world No1 tennis ace Ivanovic sported grins and held up their respective passports as they settled in for their flight. 
"On my way to Chicago with @anaivanovic!" he posted on Instagram before take-off. "On my way to Chicago with @anaivanovic!" Schweinsteiger announces his departure from England (Photo: bastianschweinsteiger/Instagram) 
The midfielder, 32, ended a torrid 18 months at Man United that would struggle to earn any entries on a highlights real of the former Bayern Munich star's career. 
Fitness and then Jose Mourinho condemned him to the sidelines before the MLS came knocking and the Red Devils let him walk out the door. 
Schweinsteiger has kept his fitness up in Spain this week as he waited for a US work visa to come through, basing himself at RCD Mallorca. 
His Fire contract is for at least £3.5m a year, down from his £130,000-a-week deal in Manchester but that doesn't seem to bother him one bit. Like us on Facebook
